title: France's crazy political week, recapped
summary: It started with the French casting their ballots to elect their representatives to the EU Parliament. It turned out to be one of the craziest weeks in French politics.

title: Court suspends French right-wing leader Ciotti's expulsion from party
summary: Eric Ciotti won a legal battle against the rest of his party's leadership, which is seeking to oust him following his unilateral decision to form an alliance with the far right.

title: French elections: Macron's former health minister to stand for left-wing alliance
summary: Former health minister Aurélien Rousseau, who resigned to protest Macron's immigration, is joining the Nouveau Front Populaire.

title: The four days that led to the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance
summary: The Socialists, the radical left La France Insoumise, the Greens and the Communists have agreed on a platform and a distribution of constituencies. They have yet to pick a leader.

title: Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance vows 'total break' with Macron policies if it wins snap election
summary: French left-wing parties said in a joint statement on Thursday they had agreed on a plan for how to form a government if they win the snap elections called by President Macron.

title: Le Pen pledges to form 'unity government' if far-right party wins parliamentary elections
summary: Marine Le Pen also said that it would be up to Rassemblement National party leader Jordan Bardella to 'choose his team' if he becomes prime minister.

title: Perfect start for Germany's Euro 2024 with 5-1 win over Scotland
summary: This is the biggest-ever win for a team during a Euro opener as Julian Nagelsmann's squad dreams of winning the home championship.

title: G7 countries agree to boost support for Ukraine with frozen Russian assets
summary: Meeting in Italy from June 13 to June 15, the G7 leaders approved a massive $50 billion loan for Kyiv, the specific details of which have yet to be worked out.

title: Deteriorating water resources threaten Perrier production
summary: According to information gathered by Le Monde and Radio France, two wells used to produce the natural mineral water have been suspended for disinfection. Nestlé Waters no longer has the volumes needed to produce 1-liter bottles of Perrier.

title: Euro 2024: From fairytales to a model in crisis, football holds a mirror up to German society
summary: Since the Federal Republic of Germany's surprise victory in the 1954 World Cup, the national team's results have often coincided with pivotal moments in the country's history.

title: French elections loom over Paris Olympics preparations
summary: With the snap elections taking place less than three weeks before the opening ceremony, President Emmanuel Macron suggested the Games would encourage voters to back his coalition instead of 'people who are not prepared.'

title: Pope arrives at G7 summit for historic address
summary: Pope Francis is the first head of the Catholic Church to take part in the meeting of rich nations.

title: French stocks drag down European markets as election worries
summary: The Paris stock exchange had its worst week in over 2 years as President Emmanuel Macron's shock decision to call snap elections plunged the country into uncertainty.

title: US Supreme Court strikes down ban on gun 'bump stocks'
summary: The Court on Friday struck down a Trump-era ban on bump stocks, a rapid-fire gun accessory that was used in the deadliest mass shooting in modern US history.

title: Olympic torch reaches Tahiti, site of Paris 2024 surfing
summary: The Olympic torch continues its tour of French overseas territories ahead of its return to mainland France and the opening ceremony on July 26.

title: Putin says Ukraine must withdraw troops and end NATO bid for peace talks to begin
summary: The Russian president said he would only enter a ceasefire and launch peace talks if Ukraine gave up four of its regions and abandoned its NATO membership bid.

title: Taylor Swift tour hands UK economy £1 billion
summary: A study by Barclays bank said almost 1.2 million fans would each shell out about £848 on tickets, travel, accommodation and merchandise to see the singer and songwriter perform in the UK over 15 summer dates.

title: Gaza is in dire need of women's health services
summary: Jordanian gynecologist Acil Jallad has treated women suffering from hemorrhage, infection, or lack of medical follow-up for their pregnancies.

title: UN climate chief deplores lack of progress at talks ahead of COP29 in November
summary: Simon Stiell says 'too many issues were left unresolved' at midyear talks in Bonn, Germany.

title: US Supreme Court guarantees access to abortion pill
summary: The Biden administration appealed to the country's highest court after a Texas judge ruled in favor of a group of anti-abortion doctors opposed to the online sale of the drug.

title: Paris to test flying cabs during 2024 Olympics
summary: Mini-helicopters carrying a pilot and a passenger will conduct test flights during this summer's competition, despite the environmental authority's disapproval.

title: The sorcerer's apprentices behind Macron's decision to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale
summary: At the Elysée Palace, Bruno Roger-Petit, the presidential adviser on historical issues, has gradually become a key player in the French president's strategy. He and a small group of unofficial advisers pushed for the decision to call early elections.

title: French elections: François Hollande, the last brick in the union of the left
summary: François Hollande's support for the left-wing alliance discredits Emmanuel Macron's framing of it as being as extreme as the far right.

title: Félicien Faury, political scientist: 'For RN voters, immigration isn't just a question of identity. It's also a socio-economic issue.'
summary: 'The RN vote is both a protest vote and a conservative vote, expressing a worried attachment to a still-existing but threatened order,' said the researcher, a specialist in the far right.

title: Cyril Ramaphosa re-elected president of South Africa after coalition deal
summary: Despite an election that produced no clear winner, lawmakers voted to put the 71-year-old back in office for five more years.

title: 'At Tesla, Elon Musk is no longer a boss, but an idol'
summary: At the automaker's Annual Shareholder Meeting on Thursday, shareholders approved, for the second time, a pay package of almost €45 billion for the CEO. It reflects a total alignment of interests in the form of devotion, which can only encourage the hubris of the 'big boss,' according to economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: EU agrees 'in principle' to begin accession talks for Ukraine and Moldova
summary: The European Union is expected to formally approve the decision on June 21. If approved, the process would still take years before both countries become members.

title: Rape in Ukraine: 'Criminals often say it's so the victims won't have any more children'
summary: A war weapon in its own right, sexual violence committed by Russian soldiers has numbered in the thousands since the invasion began. It continues behind closed doors.

title: World leaders to gather at Swiss resort to discuss ending war in Ukraine
summary: World leaders headed to Switzerland on Saturday for a first summit on peace in Ukraine, after Vladimir Putin demanded Kyiv effectively surrender if it ultimately wants negotiations with Moscow.

title: The kitchen demons
summary: Date vinegar, green banana flour, wheat starch, a zest of kaffir lime... For some devious twisted recipe creators, the more unlikely the ingredient, the tastier the dish.

title: France's left-wing alliance put to the test by Jean-Luc Mélenchon
summary: Moves to oust opponents of the radical left's leader from nominations for the upcoming parliamentary elections is the worst message to send as the left has just managed to reach an alliance.

title: UK's Princess of Wales makes first public appearance since cancer diagnosis
summary: Britain is putting on a display of birthday pageantry for King Charles III, a military parade that is the Princess of Wales' first public appearance since her cancer diagnosis early this year.

title: Art Basel fair thrives amid global turbulence
summary: The annual contemporary art event, held in Switzerland until June 16, brings together 286 galleries, including 22 new exhibitors, from 40 countries.

title: From Taylor Swift to Olympic swimming: The transformation of Paris La Défense Arena
summary: Europe's largest indoor venue will host the swimming and para-swimming events as well as the water polo finals during the summer Games. It's the outcome of lengthy negotiations between the organizing committee and the venue manager.

title: 'The spread of the RN vote reflects a social malaise that goes beyond the issue of racism'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, political scientist Luc Rouban examines how the Rassemblement National moved away from the traditional factors influencing the far-right vote in the European elections.

title: Demonstrators across France protest against far-right ahead of snap elections
summary: Thousands of French people are marching across France this weekend against the far right, with between 50,000 and 100,000 protesters expected to mobilize in Paris.
